pd induced autophagy in nci-h460 and a549 cell lines and its underlying mechanisms focusing on the role of pi3k/akt/mtor and mapk signaling pathways in pd induced autophagy . ++++ our results stress ( xref_fig ) . ++++ the lack of eif3b localization in selenite induced sgs was also observed with the human prostate cancer cell line du145 , confirming that this is not a phenomenon specific to u2os cells . ++++ unlike egp-bodies , however , eif4a is modestly accumulated in selenite induced sgs , and o-glcnac-modified proteins , which are lacking in s. cerevisiae , are found in selenite induced sgs , indicating that selenite induced sgs are not an exact counterpart of yeast egp-bodies . ++++ although selenite induced sgs are observed in both wt and s51a mefs , the sgs assembled in s51a mefs are smaller than those observed in wt mefs ( xref_fig c ) . ++++ as shown in xref_fig , pabp ( poly-a binding protein ) , eif4g , eif4e and eif4a are recruited to both arsenite- and selenite induced sgs . ++++ collectively , these results reveal that selenite induces bona fide sgs in which tiar , g3bp and poly-( a ) mrnas are selectively concentrated . ++++ the lack of eif3b suggests that the selenite induced sgs are different from not only arsenite induced sgs but also sgs triggered by many other stimuli in mammalian cells . ++++ in contrast , eif3b , a protein that is one of the most reliable markers of mammalian sgs and is recruited to sgs under various stresses , is selectively excluded from selenite induced sgs ( xref_fig , bottom panel ; compare with supplementary figure s2a ) . ++++ we noticed that selenite induced sgs are generally smaller and found closer to the cell periphery than arsenite induced sgs . ++++ in addition , although eif2alpha phosphorylation is not an absolute requirement , it appears to contribute to the proper assembly of selenite induced sgs ( xref_fig c ) . ++++ another interesting aspect of selenite induced sgs is that their biogenesis appears to involve 4ebp , which has not previously been implicated in sg assembly . ++++ among sg components that are not explicitly involved in rna metabolism , rsk2 is recruited to selenite induced sgs , possibly through its interaction with tia-1 . ++++ o-glcnac-modified proteins were also found in selenite induced sgs . ++++ selenite induced sgs differ from canonical mammalian sgs in their morphology , composition and mechanism of assembly . ++++ as shown in xref_fig a , co-staining with the p-body marker hedls/ge -1 revealed that selenite induced sgs are often found in close physical apposition to p-bodies . ++++ in contrast , rack1 , importin alpha1 and beta1 and hdac6 , which are known components of arsenite induced sgs , are excluded from selenite induced sgs , at least in u2os cells ( xref_fig c , compare with supplementary figure s2 ) . ++++ selenite induced sgs lack several classical sg components , including proteins that contribute to pro survival functions of canonical sgs . ++++ immunofluorescence microscopy revealed that 4ebp1 is not a component of selenite induced sgs ( xref_fig b ) ( 4ebp1 antibody was validated for use in immunofluorescence in supplementary figure s2c , where 4ebp1 signal was strongly reduced by sirna mediated depletion of this protein ) . ++++ in situ hybridization using an oligo-dt 18 probe demonstrated strong accumulation of poly-a-containing mrna in selenite induced sgs ( xref_fig b ) . ++++ thus , selenite induced sgs are morphologically and compositionally distinct from canonical sgs . ++++ more intriguingly , among the four canonical sg components whose recruitment to sgs promotes cell survival ( rsk2 , rack1 , importin alpha1 and hdac6 ) , three of them ( rack1 , importin alpha1 and hdac6 ) failed to accumulate in this review we discuss the biological mechanisms and possible clinical effects of curcumin treatment on cancer therapy , and neurodegenerative diseases such as alzheimer 's disease , with particular attention to the cell death processes induced by curcumin . ++++ furthermore , curcumin has an anti-angiogenic activity and it can induce cell death in a wide variety of in vitro cancer and noncancer cell cultures . ++++ thus , it is possible that discrepancy of data on protection against cell death by curcumin can be accounted for , at least in part , by this methodological bias , taking into account that the symptoms of cell death induced by curcumin can be different and depend on the cell context . ++++ in in vitro studies , curcumin inhibits proliferation and/or induces cell death in many different cell types . ++++ indeed , we should remember that in in vitro experiments curcumin can also induce cell death in normal cells , such as rat thymocytes and human t cells . ++++ on the whole , all the aforementioned data indicate that curcumin can induce cell death via different molecular pathways and with different executing mechanisms , i.e. classical apoptosis , but also mitotic catastrophe , necrosis and maybe autophagy ( xref_fig ) . ++++ clearly we are far away from completely elucidating the mechanisms of curcumin induced cell death . ++++ this can be a misleading concept , since it has been reported that cell death can occur independently from dna degradation , and very recently we showed that curcumin can induce cell death of jurkat cells despite a simultaneous inhibitory effect on dff40 and cad endonuclease activity .
the inhibition of htert is an additional mechanism by which curcumin can induce cell death in cancer cells .
